div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1637 Demanhur (mod. Damanhûr, anc. (323) Dime-n-Hor = Hermopolis parva), 1900-1901 Burial: 500 B.C. (K) Contents: 165 AR, 2 ingots Neapolis Maced.: 4 st. Scione: 1 tetradr. Stagira: 1 tetradr. Thraco-Maced.: 34 st. (satyr and nymph, Lete 17, centaur and nymph 1, cow and calf 1, boar and flowers 9, running figure 6) Abdera: 7 tetradr. Dicaea Thraciae: 3 st. Thasos: 12 st. Aegina: 16 st. Corinth: 6 st. Delos: 1 st. Naxos: 2 st. Paros: 4 dr. Miletus: 19 fr. Teos: 1 dr. Chios: 5 st. Samos: 3 fr. Cos: 1 fr. Ialysus: 1 fr. Caria: 1 fr. (as SNGBerry 1080) Lydia: 1 st. Phaselis: 1 st. Lycia: 6 st. 2 fr. Selge: 1 st. Cyprus: 5 st. 4 fr. Salamis: 4 st. Barce: 1 dr. Cyrene: 1 dr. Unc.: 4 st. (running figure 1, winged dai- mon 1, triskeles of lions 2) 5 dr. (gorgon-Lycia? 2, lion fpt. 1, bull fpt. 1, boar fpt. 1) 1 fr. (bull hd.) 1 fr. (boar hd./bull hd.) 1 dr. (sphinx) 1 tetradr. (chimaera) 1 st. (sea-urchin?) 3 (illeg. or inadequately described) Disposition: Regling records: Berlin 61; Gotha 4; Munich 2; Paris 6; Hirsch June 2, 1902, 22 † Dressel-Regling, ZfN 1927, pp. 28-104, illus. (nos. 152-8 = Abdera; no. 159 = Caria) Gaebler, Stagira, nos. 3-6, 8, 10-14, 18 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 10, no. 28 Kraay, NC 1956, p. 48 May, NC 1965, pp. 1-25, nos. 5-7; Abdera, nos. 2, 10 Barron, Samos, p. 30
